unnormalised: New Delhi: Concerns are rising over a recent spike in dengue cases across several cities. The Ministry of Health reported 1500 new cases in the last week alone, with Delhi NCR reporting the highest numbers at 600 cases, followed by Mumbai at 450. Experts are attributing this to the unseasonal rains and stagnant water pockets that are breeding grounds for mosquitoes.
normalised: New Delhi: Concerns are rising over a recent spike in dengue cases across several cities. The Ministry of Health reported one thousand five hundred new cases in the last week alone, with Delhi N-C-R reporting the highest numbers at six hundred cases, followed by Mumbai at four hundred and fifty. Experts are attributing this to the unseasonal rains and stagnant water pockets that are breeding grounds for mosquitoes.

unnormalised: Dr. R.K. Sharma from AIIMS Delhi warned about the possibility of a further surge in the coming weeks if preventative measures aren't taken seriously. He recommends using mosquito repellents, wearing long sleeves, and most importantly, ensuring that there is no standing water around homes. “Even a small amount of water in flower pots or old tires can become a breeding ground, bhai!” he exclaimed in a press conference.

unnormalised: The Delhi Municipal Corporation has initiated a fogging drive in several affected areas. They aim to cover 75% of the high-risk zones by the end of this month. Additionally, the local authorities are running awareness campaigns to educate people about dengue symptoms and prevention strategies, with a focus on early detection and seeking medical help from nearest healthcare facility.

unnormalised: There is also a shortage of rapid diagnostic kits reported at some local clinics. Health officials have assured that they are working to resolve the supply chain issues and ensure that all healthcare providers have access to the necessary resources. Citizens are encouraged to report any suspected cases to the local health authorities. A helpline number, 1075, has been launched for dengue-related queries and assistance.
